url=http://www.navy.mw.mil.pl/index.php?akcja=orkan | title=ORKAN type | publisher=Polish Navy | accessdate=21 December 2012}}</ref> |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} '''ORP ''Grom''''' is an [[Orkan class|''Orkan''-class]] [[fast attack craft]]. It is the sister ship of [[ORP Orkan (1992)|''Orkan'']] and [[ORP Piorun (1994)|''Piorun'']]. The ship was the result of a construction project undertaken by the [[German Democratic Republic]] for its [[Volksmarine|navy]], named ''Project 660'' ("Sassnitz class" in [[NATO]] code<ref name="navy"/>). After the [[German reunification|unification of Germany]] the unfinished [[hull (watercraft)|hull]]s were bought by the [[Polish Navy]] from VEB Peenewerft shipyard in [[Wolgast]] and completed in [[Gdańsk Shipyard|Northern Shipyard]] in [[Gdansk|Gdańsk]].<ref name="specs"/> After its completion in 1995 the ship was incorporated into the 31st Rocket Warships Squadron, [[3rd Ship Flotilla]].{{Citation needed|date = December 2012}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Grom}} [[Category:Ships of the Polish Navy]] [[Category:1994 ships]] {{poland-mil-stub}} {{Mil-ship-stub}}
